recipeTool

Class RecipeTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • recipeTool.RecipeTool

  • public class RecipeTool
extends Object
    This class is the starting point for application RecipeTool.
    The class also contains methods, which handle exporting and importing data.
    Author:
    Ville Salmela

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static Book book
      This Object holds all the recipes.
      private static boolean saveToDB
      This field holds the current state of loading/saving policy.
      private static Storage storage
      This Object holds all the ingredients.

      This constructor is private, thus preventing the instantiation of this class.

    • Field Detail

      • book

        private static Book book
        This Object holds all the recipes.

      • saveToDB

        private static boolean saveToDB
        This field holds the current state of loading/saving policy.
        true, if using database
        false, if using local disk

        The saving policy can change if user allows or denies the use of database, or if database is unavailable/comes available again.

      • storage

        private static Storage storage
        This Object holds all the ingredients.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecipeTool

        private RecipeTool()
        This constructor is private, thus preventing the instantiation of this class.

    • Method Detail

      • getBook

        static Book getBook()
        This method will return the Book, which holds all the recipes.
        Returns:
        Book

      • getSavePolicy

        static boolean getSavePolicy()
        This method get the current saving/loading policy as in whether to use database or local disk.
        Returns:
        true, if using database
        false, if using local disk

      • getStorage

        static Storage getStorage()
        This method will return the Storage, which holds all the ingredients.
        Returns:
        Storage

      • load

        static void load()
          throws SQLException,
                 IOException
        This method will load data from SQL database using Database and Serial, and copy it to the storage and book.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.
        IOException - if there is a input/output error.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        This method will prepare the database for this application and launch the Graphical User Interface.
        Parameters:
        args - Any arguments are ignored.

      • mayday

        static void mayday(Exception exception)
        This method will be invoked, when an unexpected exception occurs, in a way that it would normally crash the Java Virtual Machine.

        Instead of crashing, the user is given information about the exception, and encouraged to try saving and then restart manually.
        Parameters:
        exception - The exception which was not handled normally.

      • prepareDatabase

        static void prepareDatabase(String... settings)
                     throws SQLException
        This method will prepare the database for use.
        The method will accept settings as arguments, or it can use following default settings:
        ip: localhost
        port: 3306
        username: root
        password: [empty string]

        After setting up the connection parameters, the method will try to connect to db-server and create the required database and tables, if they do not exist yet.
        Parameters:
        settings - -null to use default settings
        -s1, s2, s3, s4, s5 for manual settings
        -leave empty for reading settings from a file.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is database error.

      • save

        static void save()
          throws SQLException,
                 IOException
        This method will serialize and save data from book and storage to a SQL database or local disk using Database and Serial.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if there is a database error.
        IOException - if there is an I/O problem.

      • setSavePolicy

        static void setSavePolicy(boolean value)
        This method will set saving/loading policy, as in whether to use database or local disk.
        Parameters:
        value - true, to use database
        false, to use local disk

      • test

        static void test()
          throws IOException
        This method loads test values. Files are retrieved from inside the JAR-file, and then deserialized.
        Throws:
        IOException - if loading fails.
